hypothesis_content.title: Wall Street Forecast Revision Trend Acceleration
hypothesis_content.statement: When multiple major Wall Street firms (≥2) revise their year-ahead BTC price forecasts in the same direction within a 5-day window during a NEUTRAL regime, it will catalyze a short-term momentum move in that direction, with price achieving 70% of the average forecast revision percentage within 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Institutional flows are influenced by sell-side research. Concurrent revisions signal a consensus shift among informed players, prompting institutional rebalancing and momentum trader entry. The effect is strongest when the market lacks a prior strong trend.
entry_conditions: Two or more Tier-1 sell-side firms (e.g., JPM, Goldman, Citi) issue revised BTC price targets within a 5-day period
All revisions are in the same direction (all up or all down)
The average percentage change of the new targets vs. old is >10%
BTC price is within +/- 8% of its 20-day moving average at the time of the second revision (confirming NEUTRAL regime)
Enter on a daily close above the 20-day MA (for upward revisions) or below it (for downward revisions) following the second revision

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price move equals 70% of the average forecast revision percentage (e.g., avg revision +20% target -> take profit at +14% from entry)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 5% against the forecast revision direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price moves less than 20% of the average forecast revision percentage, or moves in the opposite direction within the 10-day window.
